title: Bridge Computer-Aided Design Education Utilizing Flipped Learning and Collaborative Problem-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic engineering concepts and computer software usage
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, requiring instructional design that considers pre-service/in-service teachers' intermediate domain expertise.

learning_goals: Learners can explain and apply fundamental bridge design principles (structural mechanics, material properties, etc.)
Learners can generate simple bridge models using computer-aided design (CAD) software
Learners can effectively communicate with peers and solve design problems in a collaborative problem-based learning (CPBL) environment
Learners can achieve learning objectives independently using pre-learning materials provided through flipped learning methods
Learners can analyze problems arising in bridge design projects and propose creative solutions

resources: Online Discussion Space for Collaborative Learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
